name: Buffalo Ranch Fries
description: Homemade french fries made to crisp perfection, topped with homemade Ranch dressing and buffalo sauce!
recipeIngredient: 2  russet potatoes (peeled and cut into 1/3-inch thick fries)
1/2 cup sour cream (plain yogurt or buttermilk)
1 tablespoon minced fresh dill or 1/2 teaspoon dried dill
1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley or 1/2 teaspoon dried parsley

recipeInstructions.text: To make the ranch dressing, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic, dill, parsley, salt and pepper, to taste in a small bowl; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the ranch dressing, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic, dill, parsley, salt and pepper, to taste in a small bowl; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl with water, soak potatoes to remove the excess starch, about 30 minutes and up to 24 hours. Drain well and pat dry to remove excess water.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl with water, soak potatoes to remove the excess starch, about 30 minutes and up to 24 hours. Drain well and pat dry to remove excess water.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat peanut oil in a Dutch oven or heavy stock pot to 350 degrees F. Add potatoes and par cook until light brown, about 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat peanut oil in a Dutch oven or heavy stock pot to 350 degrees F. Add potatoes and par cook until light brown, about 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Increase oil temperature to 400 degrees F. Add potatoes again and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Increase oil temperature to 400 degrees F. Add potatoes again and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, drizzled with ranch dressing, Frank’s Red Hot, and crumbled gorgonzola.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, drizzled with ranch dressing, Frank’s Red Hot, and crumbled gorgonzola.
